readme: # Shoutpoint CCML Package for Atom.io # [shoutpoint-ccml](https://atom.io/packages/shoutpoint-ccml) > An Improved [CCML](http://www.shoutpoint.com) Experience For The [Atom Editor](https://atom.io) * Github: https://github.com/shoutpoint-inc/atom-language-ccml * Atom: https://atom.io/packages/shoutpoint-ccml ## Installing 1. Install the required [AtomLinter](https://github.com/AtomLinter/Linter) package: `$ apm install linter` 2. Install the Shoutpoint CCML package: `$ apm install shoutpoint-ccml` ## Overview This package adds extra Atom functionality for Shoutpoint's CCML telephony scripting: * Syntax hilighting. * Autocomplete CCML tags and attributes. * Smart tag closing. * Formatting source. * Basic linting for legal tags, attributes and values (including valid IDs). * Importing of external CCML and JavaScript files for module development via a "compiler". * New Project, New Document and New Module helpers. ## Example ![A screenshot of shoutpoint-ccml](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shoutpoint-inc/atom-language-ccml/master/screenshot.png) ## Platforms The package is currently known to work on OS X and Windows (7+). ## Usage Here are some instructions on our basic tools. ### Autocomplete * Type a `<` to open a popup menu that will show a list of available tags. * Selecting a tag from the menu will insert the tag with important attributes. * Tab through the attributes and values to make changes. * Within a tag, press space to get a list of applicable attributes. * Start typing in an attribute's value to (if available) get a list of possible values. ### Beautify CCML To format the CCML, either right-click on the document and select `Beautify CCML` in the context menu or go to the top menu under `Packages > Shoutpoint CCML` and select `Beautify CCML`. ### Create Documents Helpers Under `Packages > Shoutpoint CCML` you will find `New Project`, `New Document` and `New Module`. * New Project will create the necessary folders and files to get started with a CCML Project. * New Document will create an *untitled* main CCML document with DTD and opening tags. * New Module will create an *untitled* CCML module with `` and `` tags. ### CCML Linter The linter is young and currently has limited features: * Checks for legal tag names and child validation. * Checks for legal attributes, required attributes and valid values. * Validates IDs. * Checks if a `*ActionId` attribute is referencing an existing ID. ## Compiling CCML Modules By it's nature, CCML is a fairly flat markup language with a necessary bit of boilerplate code. Compiling allows you to separate and organize code into files and folders. Think classes or methods in other programming languages. These modules can be CCML or JavaScript. *Yes! CCML can execute simple JavaScript for advanced capabilities.* ### CCML Modules Here is an example of a very basic CCML module: ```xml Hello, ${name}! ``` The `` tag lets the compiler know that this is a CCML module file (and must be the first thing in the document). The attributes define the module's contract. This module accepts the variable `name` with the type `string` and returns a `boolean`. The rest is regular CCML. Add an "id" attribute to wrap the module contents in a `` tag. To invoke this module: ```xml ``` This will tell the compiler to look for `/js/helpers/GUID.js` for the module. ## Planned Features The following features will be added soon: * CCML Linter: Syntax errors, legal child nodes, legal attributes, etc. * A more advanced compiler. * ID autocomplete and validation. * Call flow diagrams. ### Having Issues? Even though this is still an alpha release, feel free to create an issue at https://github.com/shoutpoint-inc/atom-language-ccml/issues. When you create the issue, please be sure to paste any error messages you receive. ## Contributors A list of contributors can be found at https://github.com/shoutpoint-inc/atom-language-ccml/graphs/contributors. Patrick Martin ([@patrick-martin-shoutpoint](https://github.com/patrick-martin-shoutpoint)) is the maintainer of this project. ## Contributing Contributions are greatly appreciated. Please fork this repository, make your changes, and open a pull request. See [Contributing](https://github.com/shoutpoint-inc/atom-language-ccml/graphs/contributors) for detailed instructions.
